title: How to Make Pie in a Slow Cooker

methods.name: Making a Shepherd's or Cottage Pie

steps.headline: Grease the slow cooker and saute the meat and onion.
steps.description: Grease the slow cooker with butter or spray it with cooking spray. Place 1½ pounds (680 g) of ground beef or lamb and 1 chopped onion into a large skillet. Cook the meat and onion over medium heat until the meat is completely cooked. Drain off any grease from the pan and discard it. The ground meat should be at 160 degrees F (71 degrees C) once it's thoroughly cooked.

steps.headline: Combine the remaining filling ingredients in the slow cooker.
steps.description:
Transfer the cooked meat and onion mixture to the greased slow cooker. Stir in the remaining filling ingredients until they're thoroughly combined. You'll need to add:
2 large carrots, chopped
1 cup (240 ml) of beef broth
1 cup (240 ml) of dark beer (like a stout or porter)
3 tablespoons of Worcestershire sauce
2 tablespoons of tomato paste
2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour
1 1/2 teaspoons of salt
1 teaspoon of pepper

steps.headline: Place potatoes on top of the filling and cook the pie.
steps.description: Wash and peel two large Russet potatoes. Place the whole potatoes on the filling and poke them down with a spoon until they're covered with the filling. Put the lid on the slow cooker and cook the shepherd's or cottage pie on LOW for 7 to 8 hours or on HIGH for 4 to 5 hours. The potatoes should be soft. If you used ground beef, the dish is called cottage pie. If you used ground lamb, the dish is called shepherd's pie.

steps.headline: Mash the potatoes and stir peas into the filling.
steps.description: Carefully remove the hot potatoes to a medium mixing bowl. Add 1/2 cup (120 ml) of milk, 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter, and salt and pepper. Mash the potatoes using a potato masher or an electric mixer. Stir 2 cups (300 g) of frozen peas into the filling and spread the mashed potatoes over the filling. You could also serve the mashed potatoes on the side. Consider sprinkling shredded cheese over the mashed potatoes before serving the pie.

steps.headline: Fit the crust into the slow cooker.
steps.description: Spray the inside of your slow cooker with cooking or baking spray so that the crust doesn't stick. Lay one refrigerated pie crust into the bottom of the slow cooker and use your fingers to press the edges of the crust up the sides of the slow cooker. Traditional pecan pie works best in a round slow cooker, but will still work if you have an oval slow cooker. You could also lay parchment paper inside the slow cooker before you lay down the crust. This will make it easier to lift the pie out, but may make the crust softer.

steps.headline: Combine the pecan pie filling.
steps.description:
Place all of the filling ingredients into a large mixing bowl and stir them well until they're combined. Reserve about 1/2 cup (65 g) of the pecans for sprinkling over the top. You'll need to mix together:
3 eggs
1 cup (225 g) of sugar
⅔ cup (200 g) of dark corn syrup
⅓ cup (75 g) of butter, melted
⅛ teaspoon of salt
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
1½ cups (190 g) of chopped pecans

steps.headline: Pour the filling into the crust and top with extra pecans.
steps.description: Spoon the pecan pie filling onto the crust in your slow cooker. Arrange the remaining 1/2 cup (65 g) of pecans over the top of the filling. You can sprinkle them or create a decorative design with the pecans. You can leave the decorative pecans whole if you want a striking presentation. Keep in mind that whole pecans will be trickier to cut into than chopped ones.

steps.headline: Bake the pecan pie and serve it.
steps.description: Cover the slow cooker with its lid and turn the cooker on to HIGH heat. Bake the pecan pie for 2 1/2 to 3 hours or until the crust turns golden brown and the filling bubbles around the edges. If you lined the slow cooker with parchment, carefully lift the pie up and out. Or slice individual pieces and lift them out. Serve the pie with vanilla ice cream. If you're cooking the pie in an oval slow cooker, you may need to adjust the heat or time. Try cooking it on LOW for the recommended time.

steps.headline: Grease the slow cooker and cut the fruit.
steps.description: Spray the slow cooker with cooking spray or coat it with butter so the cobbler doesn't stick. Wash and slice 2 1/2 to 2 3/4 pounds (565 to 620 g) of peaches or nectarines into 1/2-inch slices. Place the slices in the bowl along with 1 1/4 cups (6 ounces or 125 g) of blueberries. You could swap out the peaches and blueberries for an equal amount of other fruit. Consider using apples, pears, raspberries, or cherries. To make this fruit cobbler, you'll want to use a slow cooker with a 6-quart capacity.

steps.headline: Mix the fruit filling and spread it in the slow cooker.
steps.description:
Place the fruit in a large mixing bowl and stir in the remaining filling ingredients. Use a large rubber spatula to incorporate the filling ingredients and pour the filling into the prepared slow cooker. You'll need to add:
1/2 teaspoon of vanilla
3/4 cup (150 g) of granulated sugar
1 tablespoon of cornstarch
1 tablespoon of lemon juice
1/4 teaspoon of fine salt

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients for the topping.
steps.description: Put 1 cup (120 g) of all-purpose flour, 1/3 cup (66 g) of granulated sugar, 1 1/4 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1/4 teaspoon of fine salt into a medium sized mixing bowl. Use a whisk or a fork to combine the dry ingredients. If your flour seems lumpy, you could sift the dry ingredients. This will help them absorb the liquid ingredients evenly.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla, milk, and butter to the topping.
steps.description: Pour 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla, 1/3 cup (75 ml) of whole milk, and 5 tablespoons (70 g) of melted unsalted butter into the dry mix. Stir the topping mixture with a rubber spatula until the dry ingredients are moist. Avoid stirring the cobbler topping too much or the cobbler will be dense and tough.

steps.headline: Drop the cobbler dough over the fruit.
steps.description: Use a large spoon to scoop the cobbler dough onto the fruit in the slow cooker. Try to dollop heaping tablespoons of cobbler dough. Keep in mind that the fruit won't be completely covered by the dough. Place the lid on the slow cooker. To help the cobbler crisp as it cooks, you can roll out enough paper towels to drape over the slow cooker before you set the lid on it. The paper towels will absorb the moisture from the steam.

steps.headline: Cook the fruit cobbler.
steps.description: Turn the slow cooker on to HIGH and bake the cobbler for 2 1/2 hours or cook it for 4 hours on LOW. The fruit should be soft and the filling will be bubbly once the cobbler is done. The cobbler dough should be completely cooked and puffy. Let the fruit cobbler cool for 15 minutes with the lid off of the slow cooker before you serve it.
